ovdesc.p: When a customer receives a release of T24, there are usually conversion programs which need to be run, due to changes in file layouts of files used by T24. If a customer is operating in a multi-company environment, some programs will have to be run in each company, thus resulting in a lot of manual input which can produce errors.

CONVERSION.PGMS is designed to automate the running of the conversion programs. One record will be released to CONVERSION.PGMS for each major release. The record will detail all the conversion programs to be run for the release, along with the level of each program. When the record is released as part of GLOBUS.RELEASE, the release procedure will determine in which companies each of the programs has to be run, depending on the application and level of the program. After the record has been checked and authorised by the user, RUN.CONVERSION.PGMS can be run to actually run the conversion programs. Once the conversion programs have been run successfully, the user should reverse the record on CONVERSION.PGMS.

This field contains all the companies in which the conversion program is to be run. It is updated when either the program name or program level is entered. The conversion program will be run in companies depending on the level and application of the conversion program. For example, if a securities conversion program is defined as being of FINancial level, the company file will be accessed to determine all financial non-consolidation, non-reporting companies in which securities is installed.
When a conversion record is released, the companies field will be updated by the release procedures, according to the companies and applications installed.

When this field is entered, the sub-value set from companies selected to run information is expanded with the company code of all the companies in which the conversion program should be run, depending on the level and application of the conversion program. For example, if a securities conversion program is defined as being of FINancial level, the company file will be accessed to determine all financial non-consolidation, non-reporting companies in which securities is installed. The sub-valued set will then be expanded to contain these companies, with the run pgm flag set to 1, i.e. the program is to be run. If there are no companies in which the conversion program is to be run (e.g. securities has not been installed in any company), the sub-value set will be null.

Specifies whether the conversion program is to be run or has already been run for the company named in companies selected.

When the conversion program record is released as part of the release procedures, the run program flag for all programs will be set to 1, i.e. the conversion program is to be run in the company specified. If there are no companies (e.g. a securities conversion program is to be run but securities has not been installed in any company), the conversion program will not be run. If the user decides that the program is not be run, the run program flag can be set to 0, i.e. the program is not to be run. It is recommended that if the program flag is set to 1, the notes field is updated with the reason why the conversion program was not run. If the run program flag is set to 0, it can be reset to 1. When the conversion program is run by RUN.CONVERSION.PGMS, the run flag is set to 2 (program has been run) when the program completes successfully. The run program flag can be set to 1 if it is currently 2, but an override message is given. Care should be taken if resetting a program flag of a program that has already been run, as most conversion programs should not be rerun.
